vague_description: Jordan needs to optimize his dietary costs while meeting specific nutritional requirements using two types of foods.
detailed_description: Jordan is a chef. He wants to design a diet consisting of Kebabs and Rice. Assume that each serving of Rice costs \var{CostRice} and contains \var{CalRice} calories and \var{ProtRice} grams of protein. Assume that each serving of Kebab costs \var{CostKebab} and contains \var{CalKebab} calories and \var{ProtKebab} grams of protein. He's interested in spending as little money as possible but he wants to ensure that his meals have at least \var{MinCal} calories and at least \var{MinProt} grams of protein per day. Formulate a linear programming problem that will help minimize the cost of the diet.
target_objective: Minimize the total cost of Rice and Kebabs
target_constraints: Number of servings of Rice is non-negative
Number of servings of Kebab is non-negative
Total calories must be at least MinCal
Total protein must be at least MinProt
target_parameters: Cost of one serving of Rice
Calories contained in one serving of Rice
Protein contained in one serving of Rice
Cost of one serving of Kebab
Calories contained in one serving of Kebab
Protein contained in one serving of Kebab
